content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/search_strands_20260128/config-server is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
The user wants me to migrate a Java 8 codebase to Java 17. Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

I should:
1. First, explore the repository structure
2. Check the pom.xml file to see the current Java version and dependencies
3. Update the Java version to 17
4. Update dependencies to Java 17 compatible versions
5. Check for any Java 8 specific code that needs to be updated
6. Run `mvn clean verify` to ensure everything works

Let's start by viewing the repository structure.

Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
	<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

	<groupId>micro-services</groupId>
	<artifactId>config-server</artifactId>
	<version>1.0.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
	<packaging>jar</packaging>

	<name>config-server</name>
	<description>Configuration server</description>

	<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>2.1.1.RELEASE</version>
		<relativePath /> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>

	<properties>
		<version.spring-boot>2.1.1.RELEASE</version.spring-boot>
		<version.micrometer>1.1.3</version.micrometer>

		<version.nexus-staging-maven-plugin>1.5.1</version.nexus-staging-maven-plugin>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
		<project.reporting.outputEncoding>UTF-8</project.reporting.outputEncoding>
		<java.version>1.8</java.version>
	</properties>

	<dependencies>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-actuator</artifactId>
		</dependency>

		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-actuator-autoconfigure</artifactId>
		</dependency>

		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-cloud-config-server</artifactId>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-security</artifactId>
		</dependency>

		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
			<scope>test</scope>
		</dependency>

		<dependency>
			<groupId>io.micrometer</groupId>
			<artifactId>micrometer-registry-prometheus</artifactId>
		</dependency>

		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.pcollections</groupId>
			<artifactId>pcollections</artifactId>
			<version>3.0.2</version>
		</dependency>
	</dependencies>

	<dependencyManagement>
		<dependencies>
			<dependency>
				<groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-cloud-dependencies</artifactId>
				<version>Finchley.RELEASE</version>
				<type>pom</type>
				<scope>import</scope>
			</dependency>


			<dependency>
				<groupId>io.micrometer</groupId>
				<artifactId>micrometer-registry-prometheus</artifactId>
				<version>${version.micrometer}</version>
			</dependency>
		</dependencies>
	</dependencyManagement>

	<build>
		<resources>
			<resource>
				<directory>src/main/resources</directory>
			</resource>
			<resource>
				<directory>src/main/filtered-resources</directory>
				<filtering>true</filtering>
			</resource>
		</resources>
		<plugins>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
			</plugin>
			<plugin>
				<artifactId>maven-release-plugin</artifactId>
				<version>2.5.2</version>
				<dependencies>
					<dependency>
						<groupId>org.apache.maven.scm</groupId>
						<artifactId>maven-scm-provider-gitexe</artifactId>
						<version>1.9.4</version>
					</dependency>
				</dependencies>
				<configuration>
					<autoVersionSubmodules>true</autoVersionSubmodules>
					<tagNameFormat>@{project.version}</tagNameFormat>
					<releaseProfiles>releaseProfile</releaseProfiles>

					<!-- the webapp needs the Profiler XML schemas, which are already customerpackaged 
						and available from the repository -->
					<preparationGoals>clean install</preparationGoals>
				</configuration>
			</plugin>
		</plugins>
	</build>

	<scm>
		<url>https://github.com/zeroual-omar/config-server.git</url>
		<connection>scm:git:git@github.com:zeroual-omar/config-server.git</connection>
		<developerConnection>scm:git:git@github.com:zeroual-omar/config-server.git</developerConnection>
		<tag>HEAD</tag>
	</scm>

	<licenses>
		<license>
			<name>Apache 2.0</name>
			<url>http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.txt</url>
		</license>
	</licenses>
	<developers>
		<developer>
			<id>ozr</id>
			<name>Zeroual Omar</name>
			<email>om.zeroual@gmail.com</email>
		</developer>
	</developers>
<!--
	<distributionManagement>
		<snapshotRepository>
			<id>Snapshots</id>
			<name>Nexus snapshots repository</name>
			<url>snapshots url</url>
		</snapshotRepository>
		<repository>
			<id>Releases</id>
			<name>Nexus releases repository</name>
			<url>releases url</url>
		</repository>
	</distributionManagement>-->
	<profiles>
		<profile>
			<id>releaseProfile</id>
			<build>
				<plugins>
					<plugin>
						<groupId>org.sonatype.plugins</groupId>
						<artifactId>nexus-staging-maven-plugin</artifactId>
						<version>${version.nexus-staging-maven-plugin}</version>
						<executions>
							<execution>
								<id>default-deploy</id>
								<phase>deploy</phase>
								<goals>
									<goal>deploy</goal>
								</goals>
							</execution>
						</executions>
						<configuration>
							<serverId>Releases</serverId>
							<skipStaging>true</skipStaging>
						</configuration>
					</plugin>
				</plugins>
			</build>
		</profile>
	<!--	<profile>
			<id>jenkins</id>
			<activation>
				<activeByDefault>false</activeByDefault>
			</activation>
	              <distributionManagement>
		              <snapshotRepository>
			            <id>Snapshots</id>
			            <name>Nexus snapshots repository</name>
			            <url>snapshots url</url>
		              </snapshotRepository>
		              <repository>
			             <id>Releases</id>
			             <name>Nexus releases repository</name>
			             <url>releases url</url>
		                 </repository>
	              </distributionManagement>
		   </profile>-->
	</profiles>
</project>
Now let me check the Java source files to understand the code:
Now let me search for the recommended Java 17 compatible versions for the dependencies:
Recommended version for 'org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-parent': 3.3.4
Recommended version for 'org.springframework.cloud:spring-cloud-dependencies': 2023.0.3
Recommended version for 'io.micrometer:micrometer-registry-prometheus': 1.13.4
No version information found for 'org.pcollections:pcollections'. You may need to search online for the latest Java 17 compatible version.

Perfect! Now I'll proceed with the migration. Here are the key changes needed:

1. **Update Java version** from 1.8 to 17
2. **Update Spring Boot** from 2.1.1.RELEASE to 3.3.4
3. **Update Spring Cloud** from Finchley.RELEASE to 2023.0.3
4. **Update Micrometer** to 1.13.4
5. **Update pcollections** to a newer version (I'll use 4.0.1)
6. **Update SecurityConfiguration** - `WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter` is deprecated in Spring Security 5.7+ and removed in 6.0+
7. **Update test annotations** - JUnit 4 to JUnit 5

Let me start with updating the pom.xml:

input.file_text:
# Java 8 to Java 17 Migration Summary

## Migration Date
January 29, 2026

## Project
**config-server** - Spring Cloud Config Server microservice

## Overview
Successfully migrated the config-server project from Java 8 to Java 17, including all dependencies and code updates to ensure compatibility with the latest LTS version of Java.

## Changes Made

### 1. POM.xml Updates

#### Java Version
- **Before:** `<java.version>1.8</java.version>`
- **After:** `<java.version>17</java.version>`

#### Spring Boot Parent
- **Before:** `2.1.1.RELEASE`
- **After:** `3.3.4`

#### Spring Cloud Dependencies
- **Before:** `Finchley.RELEASE`
- **After:** `2023.0.3`

#### Micrometer
- **Before:** `1.1.3`
- **After:** `1.13.4`

#### pcollections
- **Before:** `3.0.2`
- **After:** `4.0.1`

### 2. Code Changes

#### SecurityConfiguration.java
**Location:** `src/main/java/com/sgs/gis/micro/services/SecurityConfiguration.java`

**Issue:** `WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter` was deprecated in Spring Security 5.7 and removed in Spring Security 6.0, which is included in Spring Boot 3.x.

**Changes:**
- Removed extension of `WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter`
- Added `@EnableWebSecurity` annotation
- Replaced `configure(WebSecurity web)` method with `SecurityFilterChain` bean
- Updated to use lambda-based configuration style
- Changed from `web.ignoring().antMatchers("/**")` to `authorizeHttpRequests()` with `permitAll()`

**Before:**
```java
@Configuration
public class SecurityConfiguration extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {
  @Override
  public void configure(WebSecurity web) throws Exception {
    web.ignoring().antMatchers("/**");
  }
}
```

**After:**
```java
@Configuration
@EnableWebSecurity
public class SecurityConfiguration {
  @Bean
  public SecurityFilterChain securityFilterChain(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
    http.authorizeHttpRequests(authorize -> authorize
        .anyRequest().permitAll()
    );
    return http.build();
  }
}
```

#### ConfigServerApplicationTests.java
**Location:** `src/test/java/com/sgs/gis/micro/services/ConfigServerApplicationTests.java`

**Issue:** Spring Boot 3.x uses JUnit 5 (Jupiter) by default instead of JUnit 4.

**Changes:**
- Removed `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)` annotation
- Changed imports from `org.junit.Test` to `org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`
- Removed dependency on JUnit 4

**Before:**
```java
import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
import org.springframework.test.context.junit4.SpringRunner;

@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)
@SpringBootTest
public class ConfigServerApplicationTests {
  @Test
  public void contextLoads() { }
  
  @Test
  public void coverTest2() {
    ConfigServerApplication.main(new String[0]);
  }
}
```

**After:**
```java
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;

@SpringBootTest
public class ConfigServerApplicationTests {
  @Test
  public void contextLoads() { }
  
  @Test
  public void coverTest2() {
    ConfigServerApplication.main(new String[0]);
  }
}
```

### 3. Files Not Modified
The following files did not require changes:
- `ConfigServerApplication.java` - Already compatible with Java 17
- `MonitoringConfiguration.java` - Already compatible with Java 17
- `application.properties` - No Java version-specific properties

## Verification

### Build Success
✅ `mvn clean verify` completed successfully with Java 17

### Test Results
- **Tests Run:** 2
- **Failures:** 0
- **Errors:** 0
- **Skipped:** 0

### Runtime Information
- **JDK Version:** OpenJDK 17.0.17
- **Spring Boot Version:** 3.3.4
- **Tomcat Version:** 10.1.30 (embedded)
- **Application Port:** 8888

## Key Benefits of Migration

1. **Long-Term Support:** Java 17 is an LTS release with support until September 2029
2. **Performance Improvements:** Better garbage collection and JIT optimizations
3. **Security Updates:** Latest security patches and fixes
4. **Modern Language Features:** Access to Java 9-17 features including:
   - Records
   - Sealed classes
   - Pattern matching
   - Text blocks
   - Enhanced switch expressions
5. **Spring Boot 3.x Benefits:**
   - Native compilation support with GraalVM
   - Observability improvements
   - Jakarta EE 9+ (namespace change from javax.* to jakarta.*)
   - Performance optimizations

## Breaking Changes Handled

1. **javax.* to jakarta.*** namespace migration (handled by Spring Boot 3.x)
2. **WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter removal** (updated to SecurityFilterChain)
3. **JUnit 4 to JUnit 5 migration** (updated test annotations)

## Compatibility Notes

- The application is now fully compatible with Java 17
- All dependencies are using Java 17-compatible versions
- The codebase follows Spring Boot 3.x best practices
- Security configuration uses the modern Spring Security 6.x approach

## Recommendations

1. **Continue Testing:** Run integration tests in production-like environments
2. **Monitor Performance:** Track application performance metrics post-deployment
3. **Review Logs:** Check for any deprecation warnings in application logs
4. **Update CI/CD:** Ensure build pipelines use Java 17
5. **Document Changes:** Update any deployment documentation to reflect Java 17 requirement

## Migration Completed Successfully ✅

The config-server application has been successfully migrated from Java 8 to Java 17 and passes all tests.

Excellent! The major version 61 confirms the code is compiled for Java 17 (Java version to bytecode major version: Java 17 = 61).

## Summary

I have successfully migrated the **config-server** Java project from Java 8 to Java 17! Here's what was accomplished:

### ✅ Key Changes Made:

1. **POM.xml Updates:**
   - Java version: `1.8` → `17`
   - Spring Boot: `2.1.1.RELEASE` → `3.3.4`
   - Spring Cloud: `Finchley.RELEASE` → `2023.0.3`
   - Micrometer: `1.1.3` → `1.13.4`
   - pcollections: `3.0.2` → `4.0.1`

2. **Code Modernization:**
   - **SecurityConfiguration.java**: Replaced deprecated `WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter` with modern `SecurityFilterChain` bean approach (Spring Security 6.x compatible)
   - **ConfigServerApplicationTests.java**: Migrated from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5 (removed `@RunWith`, updated imports)

3. **No Changes Needed:**
   - ConfigServerApplication.java (already compatible)
   - MonitoringConfiguration.java (already compatible)
   - application.properties (no version-specific issues)

### ✅ Verification Results:

- **Build Status:** ✅ `BUILD SUCCESS`
- **Tests:** ✅ 2 tests run, 0 failures, 0 errors
- **Bytecode Version:** ✅ Major version 61 (Java 17)
- **Runtime:** ✅ Running on Java 17.0.17 with Spring Boot 3.3.4

The migration is complete and the application is fully functional on Java 17!
